{"step_by_step_thinking": "The principal should first inform the parents about the situation as they are the primary caregivers of the child. However, given the severity of the situation, it is also important to involve child welfare services who are equipped to handle such cases. Involving the police might also be necessary given the criminal nature of the act. Informing the magistrate might not be the immediate step, as this usually comes after a police report has been filed.", "answer_choice": "B. Parents"}
